result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Slack Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs/DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.
All court costs, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amout remaining due an dowing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to revocation sentence in 10CF4241.
The court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; also advised that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: Per order dated October 5, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP780-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected and this appeal is dismissed without prejudice.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended through December 4, 2017.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a) (2015-16).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
Motion to Voluntarily Dismiss Appeal and for an Extension of Time Within Which to File a Notice of Appeal or Post-Conviction Motion

per order dated September 7, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP780CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that, no later than October 5, 2017, appellate counsel shall obtain a true and correct copy of the DVD containing the portions of Slack's custodial interview that began at approximately 2:03 p.m. on May 2, 2015, shall file that DVD with the circuit court, and shall file a notice with the clerk of this court that the DVD has been filed. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, no later than October 5, 2017, appellate counsel shall file a supplemental no-merit report addressing the issues discucced in this order or, in the alternative a motion to dismiss the no-merit appeal and to extend the deadline for filing a postconviction motion. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, no later than October 16, 2017, the clerk of the circuit court shall transmit to the clerk of this court by supplemental return the DVD that Slack's appellate counsel is required to file pursuant to this order.
per order dated August 23, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP780CRNM,  the hold previously imposed on this matter is lifted and this matter may proceed.

per order dated August 17, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP780CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that Attorney Chesshir shall determine whether a transcript of proceedings held on May 4, 2015 remains outstanding in this case and shall, no later than September 14, 2017, file a report in this court stating the results of his investigation and the status of any request he has made to order the transcript from the appropriate court reporter. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for requesting the transcripts in this matter is extended through September 14, 2017. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, no later than September 14, 2017, Attorney Chesshir shall order from the appropriate court reporter any transcript that remains outstanding in this matter. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if Attorney Chesshir determines that a transcript remains outstanding in this case he shall, no later than September 14, 2017, file a supplemental statement on transcript in this court and file a copy of that supplemental statement in the circuit court. The supplemental statement shall reflect that Attorney Chesshir has requested the missing transcript and shall state the date on which the court reporter will file the transcript. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if Attorney Chesshir determines that a transcript remains outstanding in this case he shall, no later than September 14, 2017, move this court to supplement the record with the missing transcript. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this appeal is held in abeyance pending further order of this court.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry Slack in court with attorney Jeffrey T. Wilson.  Defendant Jerry Slack in custody.  alex mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.    Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Phaleshia G.
 The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to revocation sentence in 10CF4241.  CONFINEMENT of 6 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay stipulated restitution in the amount of $410.00 payable to Kyale C.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.
-No contact with victims.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
             Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
             Notice of Voting Ineligibility

Defendant Jerry Slack in court with attorney Jeffrey T. Wilson.  Defendant Jerry Slack in custody.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for jury trial today but a resolution has been reached.  As to count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Count 2 is ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.  
The state requests that the court hear statements of victims who are present today.  Statements by:  Jacquelyn C.; Marlena C.
Court will order a PSI and remand the defendant.  Case adjourned to 4-25-2016 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jerry Slack in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State motion to adjourn trial date due to unavailability of essential witness heard by the court.  The defense is objecting to the adjournment as this is the second request by the state.  The court will GRANT the adjourmment, but advises the state that this will be the last one.   If case is to resolve short of trial it must be brought in to the court at least ONE WEEK PRIOR to the scheduled date.  Case set for jury trial on 3-21-2016 at 8:15am  Jury trial scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Case set for motion hearing. In chambers discussion placed on the record. Discussion regarding the defendant's motion to suppress. State does not have any witnesses present in court today. Arguments heard as to defense motion to suppress. Court DENIED defense motion for reasons stated on the record but will allow defense counsel to reopen her argument upon receipt of new information. State requested an adjournment of the trial date due to witness unavailability. Defense objects. Court granted the State's request and vacated the jury trial date of 9/14/15. State placed offer on the record. Defense to file jury instructions and motions in limine by 9/14/15 at the close of business. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense counsel has all of the discovery from the State and advised the Court the defendant wishes to have a trial date.   Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense counsel will be filing a motion challenging the defendant's statements. Defense counsel to provide the Court with a copy of the DVD of the defendant's statements. Parties to file motions by 8/28/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
